verses.roman:
lavaṅga elācī-bīja--uttama rasa-vāsa
tulasī-mañjarī saha dila mukha-vāsa

synonyms: lavaṅga—cloves; elācī—cardamom; bīja—seeds; uttama—very nice; rasa-vāsa—tasteful spices; tulasī-mañjarī—the flowers of tulasī; saha—with; dila—gave; mukha-vāsa—perfume of the mouth.
translation: Śrī Advaita Ācārya fed the two Lords cloves and cardamom mixed with tulasī flowers. Thus there was a good flavor within Their mouths.
